meanings.definition: The action of causing disorder or confusion.
meanings.sent1: The disarrangement of the books on the shelf made it hard to find the one I needed.
meanings.sent2: The disarrangement of the room indicated that someone had been searching for something.
meanings.sent3: The disarrangement of the party decorations led to a fun scavenger hunt for the guests.
meanings.sent4: The disarrangement of the schedule caused chaos in the office.
meanings.sent5: The disarrangement of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to complete the picture.

meanings.definition: The state of being in a disordered or confused condition.
meanings.sent1: The disarrangement of the files on the desk was a result of the busy workday.
meanings.sent2: The disarrangement of her thoughts made it difficult to focus on the task at hand.
meanings.sent3: The disarrangement of the traffic cones caused a humorous mix-up on the road.
meanings.sent4: The disarrangement of the garden after the storm left a chaotic scene.
meanings.sent5: The disarrangement of the ingredients in the recipe led to a surprising new dish.
